intro: Croton socotranus var. socotranus, commonly known as Socotra candelabra, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its distinctive, branching structure and vibrant, colorful leaves that range from yellow to red. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine, and it is considered an endemic species with limited distribution. Due to its ecological and horticultural significance, it is a subject of conservation interest.
